Setting up a local copy of the site

There are generic instructions for setting up a Github Pages site locally here.

Quickstart (for Windows)

  • Install Git
  • Install Ruby. I installed Ruby 2.2.

  • In Git Bash:

    • Install Bundler:

      gem install bundler

    • Clone the git repository:

      git clone https://github.com/icatproject/icatproject.github.io.git

    • Enter the directory:

      cd icatproject.github.io

    • Install the dependencies:

      bundle install

    • Run the site locally:

      bundle exec jekyll serve
  • Preview the site in your browser at http://localhost:4000.

If you get the error Liquid Exception: SSL_connect returned=1..., it is because the version of openssl in the Ruby Gem repository does not come with an approved CA bundle. There are links to solutions here. If you are using Git Bash on Windows, the steps are:

  • Download the cacert.pem file from Curl here
  • Put it somewhere. I put it at C:\Ruby22-x64\cacert.pem.

  • Create/edit the file at ~/.bashrc to add:

    export SSL_CERT_FILE=/c/Ruby22-x64/cacert.pem

    (note the change to the path).

  • In Git Bash:

    source ~/.bashrc
  • Proceed with 'Run the site locally' above.
